Key Match Events: Australia defeated Bangladesh 2-0 on a waterlogged and heavy pitch during a World Cup qualifier.
Ajdin Hrustic's deflected long-range strike, later ruled an own goal, in the 29th minute and Kusini Yengi's header in the 62nd minute proved the difference.
Nestory Irankunda made his Socceroos debut and passed to Hrustic for the midfielder's heavily deflected opening goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Graham Arnold criticized the poor pitch conditions, calling it 'dangerous' and expressing concern over player welfare.
Arnold praised Kusini Yengi for his performance despite the challenging conditions and his recent lack of match fitness.
Nestory Irankunda expressed pride in making his national team debut and acknowledged areas for improvement.
Arnold was pleased with Irankunda's debut, noting his potential and the need for further development.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in sweltering conditions on a shabby, waterlogged pitch at the Bashundhara Kings Arena.
Players on both sides struggled with cramp and muscle injuries due to the poor pitch conditions.
Australia will play Palestine in Perth on Tuesday after the Palestinians drew Lebanon 0-0 overnight.
Australia are top of group I and into the next round of qualifying.
